CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1952, pg. 4, reads: "Blood Testing Program Draws Heavy Response - Mobile units making quick, free blood test will make their rounds in the Pittsburgh district in the next few weeks.  Here are photos taken at Fullerton and Wylie during the rush which kept the augmented team working at full speed all day to cope with the turnout.  At the end of two days 1,700 people had taken the free blood tests at two stations. Shown in the left panel are Dr. W. A. Mason of Atlanta, Ga., a consultant for the United States Public Health Service, which is working with the City Department of Heath in making these tests available; Oliver Rake, a technician with the City Health Department, and public health nurse, Dora Lester Diuguid.  In the left foreground is Booker T. Williams, who organized the citizens steering committee helping the project... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Dr. W. A. Mason, Oliver Rake, and nurse Dora Lester Diuguid drawing blood of man on crutches, with Booker T. Williams on left, for blood testing program, Hill District
